solution_line_template: Coach A spent ${basketball_price}x {num_basketballs}=$<<{basketball_price}*{num_basketballs}={coach_a_total_spend}>>{coach_a_total_spend} for the {num_basketballs} basketballs.
Coach B spent ${baseball_price_text}x{num_baseballs}=$<<{baseball_price_calc}*{num_baseballs}={coach_b_baseballs_spend}>>{coach_b_baseballs_spend} for the {num_baseballs} baseballs.

So, Coach B spent a total of ${coach_b_baseballs_spend}+${baseball_bat_price}=$<<{coach_b_baseballs_spend}+{baseball_bat_price}={coach_b_total_spend}>>{coach_b_total_spend} for the baseballs and a bat.
Thus, Coach A spent ${coach_a_total_spend}-${coach_b_total_spend}=$<<{coach_a_total_spend}-{coach_b_total_spend}={difference_in_spend}>>{difference_in_spend} more than coach B
